sentence: So far, Trump has endorsed primary opponents for at least five of them, including Gonzalez (who's retiring), Reps. Liz Cheney of Wyoming, Jaime Herrera Beutler of Washington, and Peter Meijer and Fred Upton of Michigan, who serve neighboring districts on the west side of the state.
title: Ten House Republicans voted to impeach Trump. Some then fell silent while others spoke up

sentence: Representative Liz Cheney of Wyoming has gone from a star in the House Republican leadership to an exiled party gadfly and truth teller.
title: A Long, Hard Year for Republicans Who Voted to Impeach After Jan. 6

sentence: Republican politicians who condemned the insurrection, even with impeccable conservative credentials like Liz Cheney, were shunned by the Republican Party or decided not to run again.
author: John Hudak
title: Around the Halls: One year since the January 6 insurrection

sentence: Committee Vice Chair Liz Cheney, a Wyoming Republican, revealed that there was "firsthand" testimony that Trump's daughter Ivanka, then a White House official, twice asked her father to call off the rioters.
author: Stephen Collinson
title: Call for Pence cooperation shows ambition of January 6 panel ahead of anniversary

sentence: Leading the pack was Rep. Liz Cheney, R-Wyo., who pulled in more than $1.97 million during the last three months of 2021, bringing her yearly total to nearly $6.5 million.
title: Republicans who impeached Trump outpace challengers in latest fundraising haul

sentence: Hours later, Mr. McCarthy did what the fringe wanted: He endorsed the woman running in Wyoming's Republican primary to oust the far right's archnemesis, Representative Liz Cheney, a former member of his leadership team who has earned pariah status in her party by speaking out against former President Donald J. Trump and the deadly attack on the Capitol that he helped inspire with lies of a stolen election.
title: Courting G.O.P.'s Mainstream and Extreme, McCarthy Plots Rise to Speaker

sentence: "A leader with honor would be rejecting -- not protecting -- the pro-Putin, anti-Semitic, white nationalist members of the party, instead of fighting against Liz Cheney for telling the truth," Jeremy Adler, Cheney's spokesman, said in a statement to CNN.
author: Melanie Zanona
title: McCarthy calls endorsement of Cheney's primary foe a 'special case'

sentence: Wyoming Rep. Liz Cheney, who was ousted from the House GOP leadership for refusing to support Trump's false claim of widespread fraud in the 2020 election, raised more than $2.9 million and finished the quarter with $6.8 million.

title: Trump targets outraise challengers, unlike some other incumbents
